page.title: 18ENERGY - STRANRAER
page.content: There are three forms of power commonly used in Stranraer.{Gas}is brought by tanker to the Industrial Estate where it is kept in tanks in {liquid form}until it is required.{Oil is likewise transported to Stranraer by tanker.{Electricity}is provided through the National Grid System. At present there is no nuclear power plant in the district although there has been a great deal of controversy over nuclear waste being dumped into the sea near Stranraer from the {Sellafield}plant in Cumbria. There has also been some talk about oil exploration in the waters off Stranraer. As yet nothing has been confirmed although preliminary surveys have taken place. { Coal}is brought into the area by contractors and{peat}is dug in the nearby hills and used for burning.
